description:
Are you passionate about supporting a dynamic HR team? We're excited to offer a short-term contract position for an HR Assistant based in Washington, DC. In this role, you'll play a vital part in our HR department, helping to ensure smooth and efficient operations. If you're detail-oriented, enjoy working with people, and have a knack for organization, we'd love to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities

Onboarding Support: Help new hires integrate seamlessly into the company, providing a warm welcome and essential information.

Remote Verifications: Manage I-9 verifications to ensure compliance with federal regulations.

Payroll Management: Input data accurately into the payroll system to ensure timely and correct processing.

Administrative Tasks: Provide general administrative support, including maintaining mailing lists and other documentation.

Data Audits: Conduct regular audits to ensure the accuracy and completeness of HR records.

Open Enrollment Assistance: Support employees in selecting their preferred benefits during open enrollment.

Background Checks: Handle background checks to comply with company policies and ensure a secure workplace.

Customer Service: Address employee inquiries with professionalism and provide clear guidance on HR procedures and policies.

HRMS Utilization: Use HR Management Systems (HRMS) to track employee data and generate reports.

Software Proficiency: Utilize ADP Workforce Now and other relevant software to streamline HR functions.

Qualifications

Proficiency in ADP Financial Services and ADP Workforce Now.

Familiarity with ATS (Asynchronous Transfer Mode) and Ceridian.

Experience With HRMS And About Time Software.

Ability to perform auditing tasks efficiently and accurately.

Experience in conducting background checks.

Understanding of benefits administration within HR.

Strong customer service skills and a commitment to excellent employee support.

Must meet all legal eligibility requirements to work in the country.

Fluent in English, both written and spoken.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

Strong organizational abilities with keen attention to detail.

Capacity to handle sensitive information with confidentiality.

A Bachelor's degree in Human Resources or a related field is preferred.

Previous HR experience is a plus.

If you're excited about contributing to a supportive HR environment and have the skills we're looking for, we encourage you to apply!

Employment Type: Temporary
